headline: Data types
text.1: The circles in this graphic represent the different data types a company collects and shares. Each circle represents one data type. The size of each circle represents the number of times this datatype is shared with other companies.
text.2: Sharing information is a key element of the current data economy. Some of that sharing is needed, useful, and in the best interests of the user as well (e.g. to protect you against credit card fraud). But not all of it is. Much data gathering and sharing shows total disregard for the user's interests. By far the most common interest served by sharing your data is advertising.
